attributes.action: Allow children travelling to meet their families to quarantine at home.
attributes.additional_details: Because current law violates the human rights of a child.
attributes.background:
Children travelling to Scotland even if exempt from requirement of Covid test e.g. under 11 years old, must still quarantine at a hotel. 
https://www.google.co.uk/url?q=https://www.bbc.com/news/amp/uk-scotland-edinburgh-east-fife-56259035

rejection.details:
The Scottish Government is responsible for quarantine arrangements in Scotland. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee.

If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Create a quarantine exemption to facilitate cross border child contact: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551012
